bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 2, 1949

div1.p: Siler requests that Hench send a number of reprints of his paper, "Conquerors of Yellow Fever," to the commanding officer of the Army Medical Center.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 2, 1949
div1.opener:
File 2F
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
November 2, 1949
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
During my visit to General Kean three or four days ago, he told
me of having received from you a number of reprints of your paper, “Con-
querors of Yellow Fever”, with a reproduction of the painting commissioned
by the Wyeth Company. In discussing the matter we both felt that in view
of the fact that the young men in the Medical Corps had but little detailed
information concerning Walter Reed and his work and the further fact that
you have several hundred copies of this reprint, it would be highly desir-
able to send a sufficient number of copies for distribution to medical
officers at Walter Reed Hospital.

I went over to see Maj. Gen. Streit, Commanding Officer of the
Army Medical Center and his Executive Officer at Walter Reed and took
with me two of your reprints. They would like very much to get 200 copies
for distribution to the staff if you would be good enough to send them.

If you have enough copies and can send them as indicated above,
may I request that you address them as follows:
Maj. Gen. Paul H. Streit
Army Medical Center
Washington, D.C.

I have not as yet been able to godown to Ft. McNair about the
plaque but expect to get hold of General Reed this week and settle that
matter within the next ten days.

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler, Colonel, M.C., U.S.A., Retired
Secretary, Walter Reed Memorial Association
